title: 452. Jeff Immelt Knows He Let You Down
description: Not so long ago, G.E. was the most valuable company in the world, a conglomerate that included everything from light bulbs and jet engines to financial services and The Apprentice. Now it’s selling off body parts to survive. What does the C.E.O. who presided over the decline have to say for himself?
author: editor@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
